name: Rainbow Relay
description:
You are a fox in a relay race.  Since you want everyone to win, your goal is to help all six teams. You will do this by passing the baton to foxes in other teams, in the order of the colors of the rainbow.

Use headphones to hear the original music and SFX!

Instructions:
[ Up / Down ] or [ W / S ]- Switch lanes
[ Left / Right ] or [ A / D ] - Speed up / Slow down

There are two modes:

  • Survival Mode: Go as far as you can without making a wrong move. 
  • Time Trial Mode: Complete two rainbows as fast as you can.  Try and beat the world record.

Tips:

  • Check the meter to know which team to help next.
  • Practice in Survival Mode, then try Time Trial mode
  • Speeding up makes your character more difficult to control

Credits:

This is the seventh Trijam for Team Twosticks!  The theme for Trijam #124 is “Rainbow; Equality”

Our thanks to the open source community for making these projects possible by providing such amazing tools for free!

C. Haine (12) Senior Vice President of Engineering.  He originated the concept and did all the coding using Scratch 3.  “This is the first lane-changing game I have made.”

K. Haine (12) is Worldwide Visual Design Director.  She designed all artwork and characters in Krita. “This time, I wanted to try doing a run cycle animation.”

P. Haine (>12) is Audio Guy.  Original music was composed in Logic Pro X.  Sound effects came from Logic or Freesound.org and were edited using Audacity.
